project: Lisa - Multi-Discipline Creative Orchestration Plugin for Claude Code
description: A Claude Code plugin that brings autonomous orchestration to marketing, PR, and branding teams, using the Ralph Wiggum Stop hook pattern. Lisa helps creative professionals automate campaign deliverables with quality gates, institutional memory, and discipline-appropriate language.

userStories.title: Plugin structure and metadata
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the basic Lisa plugin structure with proper metadata
acceptanceCriteria: Create .claude/plugins/lisa/ directory structure
Create .claude-plugin/plugin.json with name='lisa', version='1.0.0', description, author
Create README.md with overview, quick start, installation instructions
Directory structure matches Ralph Wiggum pattern: commands/, hooks/, scripts/, skills/, schemas/, examples/
All directories created and documented in README
Description mentions support for marketing, PR, and branding disciplines
userStories.notes: Foundation for all other user stories

userStories.title: Campaign brief JSON schema
userStories.description: As a creative professional, I need a structured format to define campaign deliverables across marketing, PR, and branding
acceptanceCriteria: Create schemas/campaign-brief.schema.json with JSON schema
Schema includes: campaign name, description, campaignType enum ('marketing' | 'pr' | 'branding'), deliverables array
Each deliverable has: id, type, title, description, acceptanceCriteria, priority, approved (boolean), targetKeyword, dependencies
Deliverable types enum includes Marketing types: email-sequence, landing-page-copy, social-posts, ad-copy, blog-article, newsletter, case-study, webinar-script
Deliverable types enum includes PR types: press-release, media-pitch, press-kit, crisis-communication, talking-points, media-advisory, op-ed, qa-document, fact-sheet
Deliverable types enum includes Branding types: brand-guidelines, brand-positioning, voice-tone-guide, messaging-framework, tagline, brand-story
Schema validates with standard JSON schema validator
Include examples in schema description fields for each discipline
userStories.notes: Core data structure that drives Lisa's orchestration across all disciplines

userStories.title: Example marketing campaign brief
userStories.description: As a marketer, I need a reference example to understand the campaign brief format
acceptanceCriteria: Create examples/q1-product-launch-marketing.json with realistic campaign
campaignType: 'marketing'
Include 5-6 diverse marketing deliverables (email, landing page, social, blog, newsletter)
Each deliverable has specific, verifiable acceptance criteria
Shows proper dependency ordering (e.g., landing page before social posts)
Shows proper priority values (1=highest)
Includes detailed descriptions in marketer-friendly language
File validates against schema from US-002
userStories.notes: Marketing example - serves as template for marketers

userStories.title: Stop hook implementation
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the Stop hook that implements Lisa's iterative loop
acceptanceCriteria: Create hooks/stop-hook.sh (executable, #!/bin/bash)
Reads .claude/lisa-campaign.local.md state file
Extracts YAML frontmatter: iteration, max_iterations, completion_promise, campaign_name, campaign_type
Validates numeric fields before arithmetic operations
Checks if max_iterations reached → exit 0 if yes
Reads transcript from stdin JSON, extracts last assistant message
Checks for <promise>COMPLETION_TEXT</promise> using exact string matching
If complete → delete state file, exit 0
If incomplete → increment iteration, re-inject prompt, output JSON with decision='block'
Atomic state file updates using temp file pattern
Include discipline-appropriate system messages (emojis, progress indicators)
System message adapts based on campaign_type (marketing/PR/branding terminology)
userStories.notes: Core orchestration logic - critical component, discipline-agnostic

userStories.title: Hook registration configuration
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to register the Stop hook with Claude Code
acceptanceCriteria: Create hooks/hooks.json
Register Stop hook pointing to hooks/stop-hook.sh
Use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} for path resolution
Include description field
Format matches Ralph Wiggum hooks.json structure
Valid JSON that Claude Code can parse
userStories.notes: Connects Stop hook to Claude Code's hook system

userStories.title: Campaign setup script
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a script that initializes a Lisa campaign loop
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/setup-lisa-campaign.sh (executable)
Accepts arguments: campaign-brief-path, max-iterations, completion-promise
Validates campaign brief JSON exists and is valid
Extracts campaignType from brief JSON
Creates .claude/lisa-campaign.local.md with YAML frontmatter + prompt body
Frontmatter includes: active=true, iteration=1, max_iterations, completion_promise, campaign_name, campaign_type, started_at
Prompt body includes: discipline-appropriate agent instructions, file references, completion guidance
Creates learnings.txt if it doesn't exist (with template header)
Returns success/error exit codes with helpful error messages
Includes validation and error handling
userStories.notes: Initializes the campaign loop state, adapts to discipline

userStories.title: /lisa command
userStories.description: As a creative professional, I need a simple command to start a campaign loop
acceptanceCriteria: Create commands/lisa.md with command definition
Command accepts: campaign-brief.json path
Optional flags: --max-iterations (default: 30), --completion-promise (default: 'COMPLETE')
Calls scripts/setup-lisa-campaign.sh with parameters
Displays startup message with campaign info, discipline, and iteration count
Outputs initial prompt to start the loop
Includes usage examples for marketing, PR, and branding campaigns
Error handling for missing files or invalid arguments
userStories.notes: Primary entry point for all creative professionals

userStories.title: /cancel-lisa command
userStories.description: As a creative professional, I need to cancel an active campaign loop
acceptanceCriteria: Create commands/cancel-lisa.md
Checks if .claude/lisa-campaign.local.md exists
If exists: deletes state file, reports iteration count where cancelled
If not exists: reports 'No active Lisa campaign'
Includes confirmation message with campaign name and type
Simple, no arguments needed
userStories.notes: Safety mechanism to stop runaway loops

acceptanceCriteria: Create prompts/marketing-agent.md for marketing campaigns
Create prompts/pr-agent.md for PR campaigns

userStories.title: Readability score script
userStories.description: As a marketer or PR professional, I need to ensure content meets readability standards
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/readability-check.py (executable, #!/usr/bin/env python3)
Takes file path and optional threshold as arguments
Calculates Flesch-Kincaid Reading Ease score
Calculates Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level
Validates score meets threshold (default: > 60)
Returns exit code 0 (pass) or 1 (fail)
Outputs scores and pass/fail reason in friendly format
Handles markdown (strips formatting before scoring)
Requires: textstat library
userStories.notes: Quality gate for content accessibility - primarily for marketing and PR

userStories.title: SEO validation script
userStories.description: As a marketer, I need to check SEO basics for web content
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/seo-check.py (executable)
Takes file path and target keyword as arguments
Checks keyword density (2-4% target range)
Validates meta description exists and < 160 chars
Checks for H1 and H2 headers
Validates title tag exists (if HTML)
Returns exit code 0 (pass) or 1 (fail)
Outputs specific SEO issues found
Works with markdown and HTML files
Requires: beautifulsoup4, markdown libraries
userStories.notes: Quality gate for web content optimization - marketing-specific

userStories.title: Accessibility check script
userStories.description: As a creative professional, I need to ensure content meets accessibility standards
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/accessibility-check.py (executable)
Takes file path as argument
Checks color contrast ratios (WCAG 2.1 AA: 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text)
Validates alt text exists for images (if HTML/markdown with images)
Checks heading hierarchy (H1 → H2 → H3, no skipping)
Validates semantic HTML structure
Returns exit code 0 (pass) or 1 (fail)
Outputs specific accessibility issues found
Works with HTML and markdown files
Requires: beautifulsoup4, markdown libraries
userStories.notes: Quality gate for accessibility - important for all disciplines, especially branding

userStories.title: AP Style check script
userStories.description: As a PR professional, I need to ensure content follows AP Style guidelines
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/ap-style-check.py (executable)
Takes file path as argument

Returns exit code 0 (pass) or 1 (fail)

Includes helpful suggestions for corrections
userStories.notes: Quality gate for AP Style compliance - PR-specific
